medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant abdominal pain with acute worsening and associated shortness of breath.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has been experiencing burning pain in the right lower quadrant (RLQ) for approximately 2 months, which worsened acutely last night, preventing her from sleeping. The pain remains constant and is radiating to her back. Symptoms include shortness of breath and decreased appetite, with no fevers, chills, nausea, vomiting, or chest pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation on Coumadin with pacemaker, congestive heart failure, hypertension, osteoporosis, hyperlipidemia, thyroid nodule, adrenal enlargement.
